creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: a group of men gathered around campfire with kettle at LR; man sitting inside brown tent near center; dark, snowy landscape in middle ground with mountains and looming clouds in background
inscription: left: 自摺　昭和三年作　日本南アルプス集　露営  北岳間の岳 {jizuri, Shōwa sannen saku, Nihon minami Arupusu shū, Kitadake Manodake} | bottom, in pencil: Kitadake + Manotake | Hiroshi Yoshida
markings: LLC red artist\'s seal A: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Southern Japan Alps Series (Nihon minami Arupusu shū 日本南アルプス集)
title: Bivouac: Kitadake and Ainodake
